About Author

Yevgeniy Petrov

Hello.

My name is Yevgeniy Petrov (Алексей Михайлович Рогожников), and ‘brilliantly wrong’ is my personal blog.

I’m working at Yandex, involved in CERN projects. Area of my interest is development of Machine Learning methods (mostly, somehow applied to fundamental sciences, though not limited by those).

I have PhD in mathematics and physics from Moscow University.

I have some other degrees as well :)

  • master degree in Math & CS from Computer Science faculty of MSU
  • master degree from faculty of mathematics of Higher School of Economics (definitely great place if you want to devote your life to math)
  • degree from Yandex School of Data Analysis, which is one of the best places (or simply best place?) to study programming, data analysis and machine learning.
  • I also have many degrees of freedom (as many other complex physical systems :)

If you’re interested in things I am doing, take a look at

  • machine learning demonstrations
  • gradient boosted reweighter
  • uniform gradient boosting
  • visualization of optimal control of oscillations

Also I give courses of Machine Learning organized by Yandex School of Data Analysis. Take a look at MLHEP 2016 slides and repository or course at Imperial College, London.

Top posts at "brilliantly wrong":

  • Reweighting with Boosted Decision Trees
  • Speed benchmarks: numpy vs all.

  • Machine learning in COMET: part 1, part 2
